name: Chinese Remainder Theorem
statement: Let n1,...,nk be pairwise coprime integers. Then the system x ≡ ai (mod ni) has a unique solution mod N = n1...nk.
notes: Supports explicit instance generator code for CRT solution steps and feasibility verification.

name: Structure theorem for multiplicative groups mod p^k
statement: For odd prime p and k ≥ 1, the group (Z/p^k Z)^× is cyclic of order φ(p^k) = p^k - p^{k-1}.
notes: Instance feasibility pre-filtering script uses group structure to confirm all element orders required in each problem instance truly exist.

name: Minimal polynomial for a + sqrt(q)
statement: Let a ∈ Z, q > 0 not a perfect square. Then the minimal polynomial of a + sqrt(q) over Q is x^2 - 2a x + (a^2 - q).

name: Irreducibility via discriminant (and algorithm for higher degree)
statement: Quadratic x^2 + bx + c ∈ Z[x] is irreducible over Q iff discriminant D = b^2 - 4c is not a perfect square. For higher degree or factorization questions, use Berlekamp–Zassenhaus, Newton polygon, or computational algebra, all scriptable and code-supported.
source: Standard algebra texts; CAS documentation; Berlekamp’s original paper
notes: Pipeline provides hooks for invoking required algorithm per SMART/MCP-Bench scoring and verification.
